title: Assembler
job_description:
Job Overview  
We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Assembler to join our dynamic team in a manufacturing facility. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in the assembly process, ensuring that products are fabricated to meet quality standards. This position requires mechanical knowledge and the ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment, utilizing both hand and power tools.

Duties

  • Assemble components and parts according to specifications and blueprints.
  • Operate various hand tools and power tools safely and effectively.
  • Collaborate with team members on the assembly line to meet production goals.
  • Conduct quality checks on finished products to ensure they meet required standards.
  • Maintain a clean and organized work area within the warehouse.
  • Assist with inventory management by tracking materials used during the assembly process.
  • Operate forklifts when necessary to transport materials within the facility.

Requirements

  • Previous experience in a factory or manufacturing environment is preferred.
  • Proficiency in using hand tools and power tools is essential.
  • Strong mechanical knowledge and problem-solving skills are highly valued.
  • Ability to work effectively as part of a team in an assembly line setting.
  • Willingness to learn new techniques and processes related to fabrication and assembly.
  • Flexibility to adapt to changing production needs and schedules.

Join our team as an Assembler, where your skills will contribute significantly to our production efforts while fostering your professional growth in a supportive environment!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $21.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 8 per week

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • 401(k) matching
  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Work Location: In person

title: Mechanical Assembler
job_description:
ABOUT VSE

We’ve been in business since 1981, founded on the principle of providing the best services to our customers through hard work and a commitment to excellence. VSE provides superior turn-key PCB solutions that exceed industry exacting standards. We provide assembly and engineering services for electro-mechanical products.

VSE exists to empower life-changing and life-saving technologies worldwide. We are successful because of our commitment to exceptional customer service, being nimble, and delivering the highest quality.

Our team members are humble, curious, and electric! We are team players, practicing gratitude and treating others with respect. We are passionate learners, hungry for understanding and eager to explore. We are energized with positivity, wired, and driven to succeed!

Join our team to unlock our dynamic benefits: competitive pay, generous 401k match, flexible schedules, paid time off, holiday pay, health and wellness, along with opportunities for growth and development.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Responsibilities

Responsible for all production activities of the electro mechanical assembly area in order to complete the assigned work order correctly.

Activities

Activities include but not limited to:

  • Pull kits with assigned work order number from staging shelf.
  • Identify and count all components, (standoff's, screws, washers, etc.) according to the Bill of Materials (B.O.M.).
  • Using assembly work instruction, B.O.M., and print, assemble boards paying attention to detail and instructions from these documents.
  • Machine or hand clean assemblies as needed.

Work with the following:

  • Box Build
  • Hand/Electrical tools
  • Press Fit
  • Hardware
  • Cable harness

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

  • High school diploma or equivalent; must be highly dependable with excellent attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Minimum 2 yrs. experience in assembly, preferably in PCBA assembly.
  • Ability to count accurately.
  • Good hand/eye coordination; good communication skills.
  • Ability to read and interpret documents is required along with basic computer skills.
  • ISO-9000 experience desirable.
  • Cable harness experience required.

Qualifications

  • High school diploma or equivalent; must be highly dependable with excellent attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Minimum 2 yrs. experience in assembly, preferably in PCBA assembly.
  • Ability to count accurately.
  • Good hand/eye coordination; good communication skills.
  • Ability to read and interpret documents is required along with basic computer skills.
  • ISO-9000 experience desirable.
  • Cable harness experience required.

title: Material Handler - Temp
job_description:
Sanmina Corporation (Nasdaq: SANM) is a leading integrated manufacturing solutions provider serving the fastest-growing segments of the global Electronics Manufacturing Services (EMS) market. Recognized as a technology leader, Sanmina Corporation provides end-to-end manufacturing solutions, delivering superior quality and support to Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) primarily in the communications networks, defense and aerospace, industrial and semiconductor systems, medical, multimedia, computing and storage, automotive and clean technology sectors. Sanmina Corporation has facilities strategically located in key regions throughout the world.

Job Purpose:

Performs the physical or administrative tasks involved in the shipping, receiving, order fulfillment, storing and distributing of materials, parts, supplies and equipment. Unpacks and checks goods received against purchase orders or invoices, maintains records of received goods and rejects unsatisfactory items. Lifts heavy items and may operate a forklift. Prepares and maintains records of merchandise shipped. Posts weights and shipping charges and prepares goods for final shipment. Examines, stocks and distributes materials in inventory and on manufacturing lines. May prepare kitting packages for assembly production. This job may be known as shipping, receiving, pick-packs, or stores clerks.  

Nature of Duties/Responsibilities:

Performs the physical or administrative tasks involved in the shipping, receiving, order fulfillment, storing and distributing of materials, parts, supplies and equipment. Unpacks and checks goods received against purchase orders or invoices, maintains records of received goods and rejects unsatisfactory items. Lifts heavy items and may operate a forklift. Prepares and maintains records of merchandise shipped. Posts weights and shipping charges and prepares goods for final shipment. Examines, stocks and distributes materials in inventory and on manufacturing lines. May prepare kitting packages for assembly production

Must be able to do:

1) you will routinely ensure that materials from receiving Inspection is correctly identified and put away into appropriate stockroom locations and transaction completed.

2) you will be responsible for performing shortage fill to work orders during put away procedure.

3) you ensure that all FIFO procedures are complied with when materials are received into the stockroom.

4) you will pull parts from stock to work order on a daily basis at direction of the kit-pull coordinator.

5)you will perform daily cycle count tasks at the direction of the inventory coordinator (goal 100%).

6)you will provide stockroom window service as well as cage or tape & reel issue at the direction of the stockroom Leader or supervisor.

7) you will conduct the above assigned responsibilities in such a manner as to insure that the stockroom is maintained in a neat and orderly manner.

8) you are to be trained initially in the use of Oracle data entry system for processing simple transaction and researching problem that you encounter during put away and pull kits

Education and Experience:

  • A minimum of two year stockroom or related experience.
  • Must have strong Math skill, an ability to identify various electronic components, working knowledge of electronic components SMT , and team player, punctual goods attendance, flexible work hours also required.
  • experience in Oracle system
  • knowledge of UPS/FEDEX transactions

Sanmina is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Salary Range(annual): $39,520 - $41,600 ($19 - $20 / hourly)

title: Senior Technician, Final Assembly
job_description:
Pivotal is the leader in the emerging market of electric Vertical Takeoff and Landing (eVTOL) aircraft. We design, develop, and manufacture light eVTOL aircraft and are renowned for the BlackFly, the first light eVTOL to fly manned missions and enter the consumer market. 

Efficient, compact, and simple, Pivotal vehicles are designed for a wide range of consumer, public service, and defense applications. Our distinctive tilt-aircraft architecture and scalable platform have been in development, preparing to enter the market for over 10 years. We recently announced our next-generation aircraft, the Helix, planned for general release and scalable production in early 2025. 

Mobility is one of the most highly-valued areas of technology investment today. This is the right company, in the right space, the right strategy, at the right time. We invite you to join our amazing team and grow with us. 

As a Final Assembly Technician, you will play a crucial role in the assembly and testing of Helix. You will be responsible for integrating mechanical and electrical sub-systems into the structure of the aircraft. You will also participate in the end-of-line testing of these subsystems, making sure that the aircraft is ready for flight operations. 

### Responsibilities

  • Final Assembly: Assemble mechanical and electrical components into the aircraft according to engineering specifications, blueprints, and work instructions to ensure the accurate assembly of Helix.
  • Component Testing: Perform functional tests and evaluations on assembled components and systems to validate performance and functionality, reporting any anomalies or deviations for further analysis.
  • Documentation: Maintain accurate records of assembly work and test results, adhering to documentation protocols and procedures to ensure traceability and compliance with regulatory standards.
  • Quality Control: Conduct thorough inspections of your work together with the quality team to ensure the safety and reliability of the aircraft.
  • Safety and Compliance: Adhere to all safety protocols, guidelines, and regulatory requirements during assembly operations, promoting a culture of safety and compliance within the production environment.
  • Continuous improvement: Identify and troubleshoot any assembly issues or discrepancies, provide feedback and propose improvements. Collaborate with manufacturing engineering and quality assurance teams to implement effective solutions in a timely manner and achieve production goals effectively.
  • Equipment Maintenance: Perform routine maintenance and calibration of assembly tools, equipment, and machinery to ensure optimal performance and reliability, reporting any maintenance issues or concerns for timely resolution.

###  Qualifications

  • High school diploma or equivalent; vocational training or certification in aircraft assembly/maintenance or related field preferred.
  • Proven experience in aircraft assembly, final assembly, or a similar manufacturing environment.
  • Strong mechanical aptitude and technical skills, with the ability to interpret engineering drawings, and technical documentation.
  • Attention to detail and precision in assembly work, with a commitment to quality and craftsmanship.
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities and troubleshooting skills, with the capacity to analyze complex issues and implement effective solutions.
  • Effective communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues and contribute to a positive work environment.
  • Adherence to safety protocols, regulatory requirements, and quality standards in all aspects of assembly operations.
  • Willingness to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing priorities and production schedules.
  • Ability to lift heavy objects and perform physical tasks as required in an aerospace manufacturing setting.

###  Work Environment & Physical Requirements

  • Ability to work in a manufacturing or lab environment
  • Comfortable working with small components and using precision tools
  • May require extended periods of standing or sitting

Salary range: $36-$40/hour 

Applicants must be eligible for employment in the United States and willing to work onsite at our HQ office in Palo Alto, CA. 

Pivotal offers a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, and 401k plans. 

Pivotal is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Pivotal does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

title: Assembler I
job_description:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 114,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.

Assembler I

Divisional Information

Structural Heart Business Mission: Why We Exist

Our business purpose is to restore health and improve quality of life through the design and provision of device and management solutions for the treatment of structural heart disease.

Working at Abbott

At Abbott, you can do work that matters, grow, and learn, care for yourself and your family, be your true self and live a full life. You’ll also have access to:

  • Career development with an international company where you can grow the career you dream of.
  • Employees can qualify for free medical coverage in our Health Investment Plan (HIP) PPO medical plan in the next calendar year
  • An excellent retirement savings plan with a high employer contribution
  • Tuition reimbursement, the Freedom 2 Save student debt program, and FreeU education benefit - an affordable and convenient path to getting a bachelor’s degree.
  • A company recognized as a great place to work in dozens of countries around the world and named one of the most admired companies in the world by Fortune.
  • A company that is recognized as one of the best big companies to work for as well as a best place to work for diversity, working mothers, female executives, and scientists.

The Opportunity 

This position works out of our Santa Clara, location in the Structural Heart Business (SH).

Main Purpose of Role

Working under close supervision, may perform a combination of assembly, weld, x-ray, repair, and test operations on pacemakers, implantable cardioverter defibrillators (ICDs), leads, electronic systems, and related medical device assemblies. Performs routine assignments according to specified and/or standardized procedures. Work is closely and continually reviewed. Certain problems may be referred to supervisor or more senior level personnel within assigned department.

What You’ll Work On

  • Performs Electronic Assembly functions: Assembles, welds, solders and x-rays medical devices and related parts using microscopes and applicable tools;
  • Locates and corrects problems by examining x-rays and performing visual inspection of parts; Repairs and tests units using computerized test equipment.
  • Performs Casting/Coating functions: Examines medical devices and related assemblies after molding operations to locate bubbles, nicks and/or excess epoxy; Utilizes small drills, reamers, taps and knives to access bubbles and remove excess epoxy; Patches and repairs bubbles or voids using syringes and small tools; bakes parts to cure epoxy patches.
  • Performs Mechanical Assembly functions: Kits, assembles, bonds coats and processes medical devices and related parts using microscopes and applicable tools; Locates and corrects problems by examining devices and components and visually inspecting parts/assemblies; Repairs and corrects devices and related components using microscopes and applicable tools.
  • May set-up/utilize special test equipment.
  • Performs Packaging Functions: Kits, assembles and packages devices and related accessories using applicable tools; Locates and corrects problems using microscope and applicable tools; Reviews all device documentation for completeness and accuracy.
  • Notifies supervisor of the need to replenish supplies/materials and of any production difficulties that cannot be readily corrected.
  • Performs other related duties as directed or assigned.
  • Support all Company initiatives as identified by management and in support of Quality Management Systems (QMS), Environmental Management Systems (EMS), and other regulatory requirements.
  • Complies with U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulations, other regulatory requirements, Company policies, operating procedures, processes, and task assignments. Maintains positive and cooperative communications and collaboration with all levels of employees, customers, contractors, and vendors.
  • Works with a variety of production equipment, small hand tools, test equipment, and precision measuring instruments. Also uses standard office equipment such as telephone, fax/copier, and a personal computer with standard office software.
  • Works in a production or air-conditioned clean-room manufacturing environment; requires gowning attire to maintain a particle free environment. Low to moderate noise level. Minor exposure to chemicals. May work at a desk or workstation.
  • Activities require a significant amount of time standing and/or sitting at a workstation, walking to and from different workstations, and in interaction with other assembly, inspection, engineering and production personnel. Significant use of hands and arms plus finger dexterity to lift, hold, insert, reach, point and otherwise use and operate instruments, devices and equipment, plus good eye-hand coordination. Use of voice and hearing are important in discussions with other co-workers. Requires clear vision (correctable) in reading instruments and devices, plus reading of blueprints, specifications, operation sheets/procedures, and related production documents. May on occasion lift up to approximately 25 pounds.

Required Qualifications

  • High School Diploma / GED
  • Typically six plus months of relevant training/experience in the assembly of digital/analog circuitry, devices, components or equivalent.
  • Demonstrated manual dexterity and hand/eye coordination. Must be able to use standard hand tools used in the assembly of bio-instruments/bio-devices. Incumbents are required to work cooperatively and productively with others.
  • Must be able to multi-task and rotate through all jobs performed in the assigned work group as needed. Incumbents must also be able to meet deadlines on multiple projects.
  • Incumbents are required to have demonstrated spelling, punctuation, grammar, basic math/numerical, organizational skills, and a familiarity with standard manufacturing/office equipment and procedures. The ability to read, write, and communicate effectively in English is also required; this requirement includes clear, understandable speech and demonstrated comprehension skills. The ability to successfully pass a reading comprehension pre-employment examination is mandatory.
  • The demonstrated ability to understand and comply with applicable Food & Drug Administration (FDA) regulations and Company operating procedures, processes, policies and rules is essential. Must have the ability to on occasion lift up to approximately 25 pounds.
  • Experience working in a broader enterprise/cross-division business unit model preferred. Ability to work in a highly matrixed and geographically diverse business environment. Ability to work within a team and as an individual contributor in a fast-paced, changing environment. Ability to leverage and/or engage others to accomplish projects.
  • Strong verbal and written communications with ability to effectively communicate at multiple levels in the organization. Strong organizational and follow-up skills, as well as attention to detail. Ability to maintain regular and predictable attendance. Regularly scheduled overtime is a requirement of this position.
  • Some formal training in assembly techniques; experience with assembling manufactured items in a bio-instruments/bio-devices related facility. Prior experience working in an air-conditioned clean room manufacturing environment requiring stringent environmental controls.

Learn more about our health and wellness benefits, which provide the security to help you and your family live full lives: www.abbottbenefits.com

Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that can help you build your future and live your best life. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.

Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.

The base pay for this position is $17.40 – $34.80 per hour. In specific locations, the pay range may vary from the range posted.

title: Assembler
job_description:
Sanmina Corporation (Nasdaq: SANM) is a leading integrated manufacturing solutions provider serving the fastest-growing segments of the global Electronics Manufacturing Services (EMS) market. Recognized as a technology leader, Sanmina Corporation provides end-to-end manufacturing solutions, delivering superior quality and support to Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) primarily in the communications networks, defense and aerospace, industrial and semiconductor systems, medical, multimedia, computing and storage, automotive and clean technology sectors. Sanmina Corporation has facilities strategically located in key regions throughout the world.

Job Purpose:  
Performs a wide variety of electronic or electro-mechanical assembly operations on assemblies or sub-assemblies. Determines and/or follows methods and sequence of operations in performing wiring, component installation, cable harnessing on assembly units. Makes setups and adjustments holding tolerances to blueprint specifications.

Nature of Duties/ Responsibilities:  

  • Must have at least 2-4 years of experience and knowledge of electronic sub assemblies & system integration.
  • Is responsible for assembly, and quality control of mechanical components and systems.
  • Role involves working from detailed engineering instructions, drawings, and specifications to ensure the accurate assembly of mechanical parts and equipment.
  • Must be able to use hand tools & power tools to assemble units.
  • Maintain accurate records of assembly processes, results, ensuring proper documentation of work.
  • Track and maintain parts, tools, and equipment inventory, ensuring materials are stocked for continuous production.
  • Adhere to company safety protocols and maintain a clear and organized workplace.
  • Knowledge of ISO standards or other industry certifications is a PLUS.

Education and Experience:

  • Previous experience in mechanical assembly or a related field preferred.
  • Manual dexterity skills (proficiency with hand and power tools).
  • Basis understanding of mechanical systems and components.
  • Problem solving skills and must be a team player.
  • Ability to communicate and follow the manufacturing process Instruction in English.
  • Previous knowledge (one + year) of electronic sub assemblies & system integration.
  • Be able to lift up to 20-45 pounds.
  • Be able to work during weekends & flexibility time if needed.

Sanmina is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Salary Range(annual): $45,760 - $49,920 ($22 - $24 / hourly)

Actual base pay within this range (determined at the offer stage) will be based on a candidate's years of relevant work experience, education, certifications, and skills, and is just one element of our total rewards package. The total rewards package also includes a variety of benefits, including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business and, depending on the role, may include eligibility for restricted stock unit awards and participation in a discretionary bonus program.

title: Mechanical Assembler II
job_description:
Mechanical Assembler II (Day/Swing Shift)  
Swing shift Available  
Hourly $24.00 - $28.00  
Full-Time / Temporary (with the ability to convert to permanent)

  • We are not accepting candidates from third-party agencies.

About Us:

Vantedge Medical is the premier metals-based med-tech solutions partner from concept to full-scale manufacturing. We are at the forefront of precision engineering and innovation, specializing in the development and manufacturing of vital components for medical markets such as Robotic Assisted Surgery, Orthopedics, Surgical Instruments, Dental, and more. Our teams work in unison, collaborating and problem-solving to serve the manufacturing needs of the top Medical Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) around the globe. Making a difference in the lives of patients and their families drives us to go above and beyond every day. With a steadfast commitment to advancing medical technology, we take immense pride in the work we do – and have a lot of fun doing it.

About the Role:

This position is responsible for building electro-mechanical products in accordance with customer supplied assembly documentation and Vander-Bend Manufacturing standards.

Responsibilities:

  • Assembles mechanical, electrical, and electronic parts and components into higher level products independently or under limited supervision
  • Follows written or electronic assembly instructions in the form of “MPI”s” (Manufacturing Process Instructions), blueprints, and verbal instructions.
  • Uses primarily hand tools for assembly, including mechanical tools such as manual, battery, and pneumatic screwdrivers, wrenches, and riveters, as well as electrical assembly tools such as crimpers, cutters, and hand soldering equipment.
  • Sets up work area, selects tools required to complete the operation.
  • Assures accurate logging of labor hours and accurate part quantities into Visual Manufacturing ERP
  • Reviews completion of previous operations and notifies the lead if omission or discrepancy from a previous operation is detected.
  • Performs low to moderate level product testing using established methods and fixtures.
  • Reads, understands, interprets, and accurately follows complex written assembly instructions without assistance
  • Provides technical assistance to less skilled assemblers.

Requirements / Skills:

  • Requires minimum of 10 years of previous assembly work, 5 years of which must be directly related to Electro-Mechanical products.
  • Experience performing detailed tasks hour after hour (intricate tape masking).
  • High School Diploma.
  • Requires ability to use various shop tools including pneumatic screwdrivers, wrenches, riveters, crimpers, cutters, and hand soldering equipment.
  • Must have basic math skills.
  • Must have basic computer skills (finding and opening documents, filling in forms).
  • Requires ability to read, write and understand written documents in English.
  • Good dexterity.
  • Ability to remain focused on detailed tasks for long periods of time.
  • Must be able to stand for extended periods of time.

Equal Opportunity Employer  
This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

title: Graphic Production Associate
job_description:
About the Role:

We are seeking a reliable, hands-on, and detail-oriented Graphic and Print Production Associate to join our dynamic team. This role blends creativity with mechanical aptitude—ideal for someone who enjoys working with their hands, thrives in a fast-paced environment, and takes pride in delivering high-quality visual products.

You'll be responsible for the operation of various print and production equipment, assembly and finishing of printed materials and signage, occasional delivery of finished goods, and maintaining a safe, clean, and organized workspace.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Operate a variety of digital and wide-format printing equipment
  • Trim, mount, laminate, and assemble printed graphics and signage with precision
  • Conduct basic troubleshooting and maintenance of production machinery
  • Ensure accurate setup and output according to specifications
  • Assist in packaging, labeling, and preparing items for delivery or pickup
  • Perform occasional deliveries in a company vehicle (valid driver’s license required)
  • Collaborate closely with design, sales, and installation teams to meet project timelines
  • Maintain a clean, organized, and safe work environment
  • Track inventory levels of substrates, inks, and supplies and report low stock
  • Follow production schedules and update job tracking systems as needed

What We’re Looking For:

  • Basic mechanical knowledge and comfort working with production tools and equipment
  • Previous experience in print production or sign-making is a big plus
  • Strong attention to detail and commitment to high-quality output
  • Ability to follow written instructions, specs, and production workflows
  • Reliable and punctual, with strong time management skills
  • Positive attitude and willingness to work collaboratively within a team
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs and stand for extended periods
  • Comfortable driving a small delivery vehicle (e.g., cargo van) if needed

Nice to Have (but Not Required):

  • Experience with RIP software, large-format printers, plotters, laminators, or CNC routers
  • Basic knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator)
  • Familiarity with signage materials (vinyl, coroplast, foamcore, PVC, acrylic, etc.)
  • Forklift certification or warehouse experience

Why Join Us?

  • A team-oriented and supportive workplace
  • Opportunities to learn and grow within the company
  • Diverse and creative projects—no two days are exactly alike
  • Casual but professional environment where craftsmanship is valued

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $26.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Supplemental Pay:

  • Overtime pay

License/Certification:

  • Driver's License (Required)

Ability to Commute:

  • Redwood City, CA 94063 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

  • Redwood City, CA 94063: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Production Wire Harness Assembler
job_description:
Description: 

Position Overview

As an Assembler in our cable harness manufacturing team, you will play a crucial role in building high-quality custom cables that meet the precise specifications of our clients. Using a range of hand and power tools, fixtures, work instructions, and test equipment, you will perform a series of operations to accurately assemble components into finished products, ensuring they meet both company and industry standards.

Responsibilities

  • Component Assembly: Expertly assemble components and sub-assemblies into the required configurations, allowing for a thorough evaluation of their characteristics and performance.
  • Adherence to Instructions: Follow detailed written or electronic assembly instructions, including Manufacturing Process Instructions (MPIs), blueprints, and verbal directives, ensuring each assembly meets the specified criteria.
  • Inventory Management: Verify parts count and special packaging or handling requirements to maintain inventory accuracy and product integrity.
  • Operational Setup: Set up parts in the designated work area, select the necessary tools, perform basic testing such as pull tests, and submit the first piece for Quality Assurance approval.
  • Process Control: Accurately determine when a process is complete, ensuring precision in product count and assembly quality.
  • Problem Resolution: Immediately notify the supervisor of any product discrepancies or equipment malfunctions, actively contributing to continuous improvement efforts.
  • Safety and Compliance: Adhere strictly to established company policies and procedures, with a strong emphasis on safety regulations and the use of personal protective equipment.
  • Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with team members and supervisors to achieve production goals and resolve issues promptly.
  • Continuous Improvement: Engage in ongoing training and development to enhance skills and stay updated on industry standards.
  • Additional Duties: Perform other related duties as assigned, demonstrating flexibility and adaptability to meet evolving production needs.

Requirements: 

Qualifications

  • Experience: 2-5 years of hands-on experience in wire harness assembly, with a deep understanding of IPC WHMA-A-620E workmanship standards.
  • Technical Skills: Proficient in soldering, crimping, and stripping wires, with a solid understanding of wire harness mechanical assembly.
  • Time Management: Strong ability to manage time effectively, prioritizing tasks to meet deadlines and production schedules.
  • Physical Requirements: Capable of lifting up to 25 pounds and working in a physically demanding environment.
  • Communication Skills: Able to comprehend and follow moderately complex written and verbal instructions.
  • Tool Proficiency: Skilled in using hand tools, crimpers, wire cutters, drills, and other related wire preparation tools.
  • Documentation Expertise: Knowledgeable in reading and interpreting blueprints or drawings to ensure cable assemblies are built to exact specifications.
  • Attention to Detail: A keen eye for detail, ensuring each assembly meets the highest standards of quality and accuracy.

Recognized as a technology leader, Sanmina Corporation provides end-to-end manufacturing solutions, delivering superior quality and support to Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) primarily in the communications networks, defense and aerospace, industrial and semiconductor systems, medical, multimedia, computing and storage, automotive and clean technology sectors. title: Production Operator 1- SMT Feeder Set Up (Day Shift)
job_description:
Unigen, headquartered in Newark, California, is a trusted partner for businesses seeking to power their next generation of products. Founded in 1991, we've grown into a leading provider of electronics manufacturing services (EMS), offering a comprehensive suite of solutions from design and manufacturing to supply chain management. From advanced memory modules to high-density storage devices, our solutions are engineered to meet the demanding needs of today's technology landscape. Our commitment to quality and innovation ensures that our partners have the tools they need to succeed. 

At Unigen, you'll have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects and make a real difference. Working at Unigen means you'll be surrounded by other innovative companies, have access to top talent, and be close to world-class resources. We offer competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package, including 401(k) matching. This location, combined with our benefits, provides a unique advantage for those looking to thrive in the semiconductor industry. 

Job Title: Production Operator I- SMT Feeder Set Up (Day Shift)  
Department: Production

Job Overview:  
Production Operator 1 sets up and operates production machines and equipment. Reports to Production Supervisor and is located in Newark, CA.  

Primary Job Responsibilities:  
1\. Responsible for the overall operation of the assigned production line/unit  
Offline feeder setup, tear down and component recognition  
SMT machine operating  
AOI machine operating and QC  
PCBA general rework  
PCBA trace, BGA pad rework  
Handload, mechanical assembly  
Handload, wave soldering machine operating, washer operating  
AXI machine operating and QC  
SRT machine operating  
Routing/depanelization/Press Fit  
ICT testing  
FCT testing  
Burn in  
Box build  
HiPot  
Hynix Test  
Hynix QC  
Hynix operations exclude Hynix Test and QC  

2\. Execute written/verbal instructions given by supervisor and monitor efficiency and quality of assigned routine tasks.  
Read and follow work instructions and visual aids  
Check and inspect task results against predetermined standards,  
Identify, communicate, and escalate production issues and problems  

Key Tools and Technology:  
Semi-automatic and automatic assembly equipment and tools (SMT, AOI, AXI, press fit, washing machine, tester, MPM/dek printer, reflow oven, stencil, feeder support pins and other equipment)  
ESD equipment  
Production documents: work instructions, product specifications, bill of material (BOM) and other documents  
MS Office (Word, Excel)  
ADP Workforce Now (Employee Self-Service Portal)  

Required Education and Experience:  
1\. High school diploma is desired  
2\. Minimum 1 year work experience in manufacturing production environment  

Work Context and Conditions:  
1\. Indoors, environmentally controlled and secured  
2\. Highly structured work environment  
3\. Daily use of telephone, email and face-to-face communication with Production team  
4\. Importance of being accurate regarding work instructions and production tasks and process  
5\. Moderate time pressure required to operate production equipment and enter data daily  
6\. Team work  
7\. Completer-finisher role  
8\. High security and safety standards  
9\. Occasional lifting of up to 50 pounds  
10\. Standing an eight-hour work shift with mandatory rest and lunch breaks

title: PCB Assembly/Rework Technician
job_description:
If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high-performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. Through our broad technology expertise and one of the most extensive product portfolios in the industry, we are Connecting Everyone and Everything, All the Time.

At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management, and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creative thinking. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together are changing the way the world communicates.

Requisition ID: 75230

##  Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled PCB rework and assembly Technician to assist our engineering team in the development of RF Front End Modules. You will be working closely with talented minds transforming technology with new ideas. Our fast-paced environment enables you to collaborate with experts at all levels within the company and make real-world contributions by working on critical projects for delivery to customers with significant impacts. We invite you to come to be a part of the wireless networking revolution as you turn on and power-up your career.

The ideal candidate should have extensive hands-on experience with phone board rework, assembly, soldering fine pitch passive components, manual flip chip assembly, precision rework on sensitive devices and support RF testing. This role involves working under a microscope for detailed inspection and rework activities on multi-layer complex PCBs.

##  Job Responsibilities

  • Provide technical support to engineers to develop state-of-the-art technology for future wireless applications.
  • Rework logic boards used in mobile devices, including desoldering and resoldering components.
  • Rework RF Front End Modules to assist the engineering team in debugging at both the module and board level.
  • Demonstrate strong knowledge of soldering and reflow properties.
  • Diagnose and troubleshoot issues with phone boards using specialized diagnostic tools and techniques.
  • Oversee inventory and maintain traceability of customer property, along with necessary parts and tools for rework.
  • Effectively communicate technical issues and repair processes with the engineering team.
  • Stay updated on the latest mobile technologies and repair techniques.
  • Follow ESD protocols to ensure product safety and keep detailed ESD documentation and records.
  • Familiarity with RF test equipment such as multimeters, spectrum analyzers, VNAs, oscilloscopes, signal generators, power meters, and power supplies is beneficial but not mandatory.

##  Job Qualifications

  • The candidate should have relevant experience working with rework and assembly of logic boards used in mobile applications, or an associate degree with a minimum of 2 years’ experience in manual PCB rework and assembly.
  • Proficiency in diagnostics and repair of highly complex PCB design, containing a dense network of integrated circuits and components that are intricately interconnected.
  • A team-oriented attitude, strong sense of accountability, ownership, and excellent organizational skills are crucial for this role.
  • Excellent English writing and communication skills, as well as proficiency in MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint, are required.
  • Experience with AutoCAD is preferred.

Skills:

  • Technical expertise in the repair of logic board used in mobile applications
  • Problem-solving abilities to diagnose and fix complex issues.
  • Manual dexterity for precise soldering and component replacement.
  • Attention to detail to ensure high-quality rework.

The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is currently USD $29.33 - $50.96 per hour. Starting base pay will depend on relevant experience and skills, training and education, business needs, market demands, the ultimate job duties and requirements, and work location. Skyworks has different base pay ranges for different work locations in the U.S. Benefits include access to healthcare benefits (including a premium-free medical plan option), a 401(k) plan and company match, an employee stock purchase plan, paid time off (including vacation, sick/wellness, parental leave), among others. Employees are eligible to participate in an incentive plan, and certain roles are also eligible for additional awards, including recognition and stock. These incentives and awards are based on individual and/or company performance.

Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Skyworks strives to create an accessible workplace; if you need an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at accommodations@skyworksinc.com.

title: Manufacturing Associate
job_description:
Responsibilities:

  • Excellent employment opportunity for a Manufacturing Associate I-Assembly & Packaging in the Fremont, CA area.
  • 2nd Shift: Monday-Friday, 2:00PM – 10:30PM
  • Executes routine unit operations in Manufacturing Assembly and Packaging as assigned related to the manufacturing of drug product in a multi-product facility.
  • Performs duties under limited supervision and according to standard operating and manufacturing procedures.
  • This position is responsible for assisting the Sr. Associate and Master Associate in performing assembly and packaging in designated functional manufacturing area.
  • Support with troubleshooting to equipment.
  • Assists in the setup of the automated autoinjector assembly machine, pre-filled syringe assembly machine and semi-automated tabletop machine.
  • This assistance includes tasks such as gathering tools, machine parts and documents required for such activities. Retrieves components and equipment from storage
  • Assists with the equipment changeover
  • Assists with minor equipment repairs/adjustments
  • Assists with real-time identification and correction of problems.
  • Problems may include, but are not limited to mechanical issues, component issues
  • Performs all work in accordance with Company Policies and Procedures.
  • All work is documented in controlled documents (batch records, logbooks or SOP attachments) in accordance with SOP.
  • All activities are to be documented in the batch record.
  • All events are to be recorded in the batch record and brought to the attention of the production supervisor for further action.
  • Assists with room cleaning in production areas.
  • Will transfer rubbish to the transfer zones and may empty transfer zones of rubbish when required.
  • This includes removal of equipment, room sanitization and disposal of waste according to established safety requirements
  • Responsible for following controlled documents to ensure that the equipment identified for operations are used and documented.
  • This includes verification of equipment calibration.
  • Completes logbooks, as required.
  • Responsible for performing assembly and packaging operations and assisting in visual inspection/filling operations, if required.
  • Ensures components, materials and supplies are stocked prior to the start of the assembly and packaging operations

Movement of product and components within the assembly and packaging area

  • Transfer product, components and equipment within the CNC area.
  • Communication and hand-off to relief personnel during shift change as appropriate
  • Maintains production areas according to predefined standards (5s)
  • Adheres to safety standards, identifies unsafe situation / habit and escalates appropriately

Experience:

  • High School degree plus minimum one (1) year work experience in GMP regulated industry
  • Associate/Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution or biotechnology vocational training preferred
  • Demonstrated ability to be organized and work well in small work groups.
  • Demonstrated mathematical skills, including the ability to perform addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, and conversions.
  • Detail oriented. Demonstrated ability to read, comprehend, and follow written instructions.
  • Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills are required.
  • Must be able to work in a team environment.
  • Experiences in related GMP environment within biotechnology/pharmaceutical industry strongly preferred
  • Must be able to learn and perform basic computer operations such as MS Office and Outlook and other computer-based software
  • Physical Demands / Surroundings - Requires physical activity such as almost constant standing, walking.
  • Works regularly under desirable conditions with some moderately disagreeable conditions in the manufacturing setting
  • The position requires concentration as errors might cause minor to moderate delays, confusion, or expense to correct.
  • The position has some contact with other departments and the associate must be able to discuss issues and ideas with an open mind and even temper.
  • The schedule is dependent on the shift for which the associate is hired. Attendance requirements are based on general attendance policies.
  • Must obtain & maintain qualifications, as required, to perform the assigned work.
  • Must understand, will be held accountable for and must adhere to all SOPs, company Policies and Procedures
  • Must adhere to proper technique, proper documentation practices, and all other aspects of the cGMP's

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Work Location: In person

title: Cable & Wire Harness Assembler
job_description:
SUMMARY: Under limited direction of a lead/supervisor/manager, provides assembly support in building cable and/or wire harness assemblies.

PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Reads and follows processes and performs work as assigned
  • Cuts, strips, crimps, or otherwise assembles the materials used to produce cable assemblies
  • Distinguishes colors and read small print in order to perform procedural process
  • Learns and retains information, relating to standards and specifications, through provided classroom and on the job training
  • Ability to evaluate any mechanical or material issues
  • Place finished goods in the designated area
  • Maintains a clean and safe work area
  • Performs other related duties and assignments as required.

  • Ability to communicate with manager and follow written and verbal instructions.
  • Ability to interpret all documentation, including SOPs, work instructions, customer supplied drawings and IPC-620 workmanship standards.
  • Ability to solder RoHS compliant materials.

NON-ESSENTIAL JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  • Basic computer skills (database management, word processing and spreadsheet)
  • Certified to IPC-A-610 or 620 workmanship standards
  • Knowledge of ISO 9001:2015 quality standards

  • A basic level of proficiency with various hardware and assembly materials and tools is a must.
  • A basic level of proficiency with various hardware and assembly materials and tools is a must.

About CTEMS

CTEMS has been in the cable and electro-mechanical assembly market for almost a decade, with manufacturing and distribution in Fremont as an ISO 9001:2015, UL and NMSDC MBE certified company. With our diverse manufacturing capabilities in OEM / ODM, our cables and mechanical assemblies can be found in the industrial, automotive, computer, telecommunications, medical, RF and consumer markets.

title: Electronic Assembler
job_description:
MUST BE WILLING TO TRAVEL - MUST BE OK WITH TEMPORARY STRIKE/CONTRACT WORK

OCCUPATIONAL SUMMARY:

Plan, lay out, develop, fabricate parts, and build electrical/electronic wiring aids. Perform complete operations to fabricate, assemble and install production and/or first article units, such as control consoles, junction boxes, instrument panels, relay panels, battery racks, engine and interconnect harnesses. Follow solder legends and setup and operate flow soldering equipment to solder printed circuit boards and their components.

WORK PERFORMED:

Plan, lay out, develop, fabricate parts, and build electrical/electronic wiring aids for production use. Perform complete operations to fabricate, assemble and install production and/or first article units, such as control consoles, junction boxes, instrument panels, battery racks; engineand interconnect harnesses, working from schematics, wiring diagrams, operation instruction sheets, travelers, sketches: engineering detail drawings, oral instructions and established shop practices.

Review planning releases and engineering changes for their effect on wiring assemblies and modify wiring aids to incorporate required changes.

Select, brand, cut, route, fasten, solder, sleeve, tie and lug wires; assemble and install wiring harnesses; locate, drill, mount, and fasten components; install in proper sequence in control consoles, junction boxes, instrument panels and relay panels, resistors, capacitors, filters, diodes, circuit boards, heat and speed sensors, transformers, meters, malfunction status indicators, circuit breakers, and fuses. Follow detailed solder legends and set up and operate flow soldering equipment to solder printed circuit boards and their components

.Check own work by means of continuity tester, voltmeters, ohmmeters, power supplies, bridges, or testing fixtures.

May perform work operations under direct guidance where adequate information has not yet been determined and furnished such as routing and part locations and where critical dimensions, locations, adjustments, and coordinated locations are required.

Perform rework of the nature and level of difficulty described herein.

Job Types: Contract, Temporary

Pay: $24.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 60 per week

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • 4 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Evening shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift

Work Location: On the road

title: Solar Turbine Assembly
job_description:
MUST BE WILLING TO TRAVEL- MUST BE OK WITH TEMPORARTY CONTRACT/STRIKE WORK

OCCUPATIONAL SUMMARY:

Lay out, join, form, fasten, assemble, install and functionally check prefabricated sheet, tubular, machined, mechanical or formed parts and assemblies preparatory to, during and after welding, installation and during or after tool proofing. Load braze alloys; make and install core; and deburr such items as machined parts.

WORK PERFORMED:

Work from written and verbal instructions to lay out, assemble and install prefabricated sheet, tubular, machined, mechanical, and formed parts to build up subassemblies and assemblies.

Prepare mixtures of braze alloys and adhesives and apply to various assemblies prior to furnace brazing. Prepare and apply proper stop-off.

Perform complete setup for any cell size and operate core fabricating machines to fabricate metal honeycomb cores per specifications.

Hand finish machined and other parts and assemblies to close tolerances, involving varied contours, holes, radii, angles and flanges.

Operate material pouring equipment and such processing equipment as degreasers, metal finishing machines and ovens.

Identify materials, parts and assemblies as required.

Prepare surfaces of parts and assemblies prior to painting. Includes cleaning, sanding and masking.

Operate on-line, computer-aided x-ray equipment where film developing and certification are not required.

Loads, unloads and operates fuel control test fixtures. Verifies and records data from testing process

Job Types: Contract, Temporary

Pay: $24.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 60 per week

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • 4 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Evening shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift

Work Location: On the road

title: Pcb Assembler
job_description:
# Urgently hiring 3rd shift Box Build Assemblers in Milpitas, pays a 20% differential!

#  Apply now to be considered for the hiring event on 4/26!

##  Job Description

We are seeking a skilled PCB Assembler to join our team. The role involves performing box build assemblies using visual aids and work instructions. The candidate will be responsible for mechanical and electronic assembly operations, including the installation of wire harnesses, cable assemblies, and other electronic components. The position offers various shifts with differential pay for swing and grave shifts.

##  Responsibilities

  • Perform box build assemblies using visual aids and work instructions.
  • Conduct mechanical assembly operations using standard measuring tools and techniques.
  • Perform electronic assembly operations such as installation of wire harnesses and cable assemblies.
  • Set up and use tools and equipment in the box build area.
  • Escalate quality issues to the leader.
  • Maintain 5S discipline in the working area and adhere to ISO 9001 and IPC-610 standards.

##  Essential Skills

  • Experience in assembly, PCB, box build, and cable assembly.
  • Proficiency in blue print reading, cabling, surface mount, and PCB assembly.
  • Minimum of 2-5 years of experience as a mechanical operator in an electronics manufacturing environment.
  • Attention to detail.
  • Ability to work autonomously.
  • Strong sense of responsibility.

##  Additional Skills & Qualifications

  • Experience with ISO 9001 and IPC-610 standards.

##  Why Work Here?

Join a supportive team where integrity, flexibility, punctuality, and teamwork are highly valued. We offer opportunities for overtime and encourage a culture of continuous improvement.

##  Work Environment

The role requires maintaining data integrity and flexibility to work overtime. Punctuality and strong teamwork skills are essential. The work environment adheres to 5S discipline and ISO 9001 standards, ensuring a clean and organized workspace.
